required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Surufatinib Combined With Toripalimab in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Open-label, Single-arm, Multi-center Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Surufatinib Combined With Toripalimab in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase II, single arm, open-label, multicenter study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Surufatinib combined with Toripalimab in patients with advanced solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: The study population is about 200 patients with advanced solid tumors, who fails or cannot tolerate standard therapies, or for whom no effective standard therapy is available, or who refuses standard therapies. Surufatinib 250 mg once a day (QD) will be orally administrated and Toripalimab 240mg will be intravenously administered every 3 weeks up to documented disease progression, development of unacceptable toxicity, participant request, or withdrawal of consent. For Toripalimab, the upper time limit for treatment is 2 years. The primary objective is safety of safety run-in (about 6 patients) and objective response rate (ORR) of Surufatinib combined with Toripalimab in patients with advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse events (AEs) of safety run-in part
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 1 Day 1 to the end of Cycle 2 Day 7 (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: The AEs of the first 6 patients were evaluated by the possibly occurs Dose Limited Toxicity (DLT).

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, death, new anti-cancer therapy(up to approximately 2 years)
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of confirmed complete response or partial response (RECIST1.1).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, death, new anti-cancer therapy(up to approximately 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of confirmed complete response or partial response (irRECIST).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, death, new anti-cancer therapy (up to approximately 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration from the first time reported partial response or complete response to the first time of disease progression or death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, death, new anti-cancer therapy (up to approximately 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: A duration from the date of initial treatment with Surufatinib combined with Toripalimab to disease progression or death of any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, death, new anti-cancer therapy (up to approximately 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients whose tumor volume control (reduced or enlarged) reaches a predetermined value and can maintain a minimum time limit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose of study drug until withdrawal of consent or death (up to approximately 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration from the date of initial treatment with Surufatinib plus toripalimab to the date of death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For each participant, from the first participant first dose until 30 days after the last dose (up to approximately 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered an investigational product.Safety and tolerance evaluated by incidence, severity and outcomes of AEs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: half of hour predose of Toripalimab for Cycle 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 (each cycle is 21 days) and 30 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected and analyzed. Serum ADA will be detected by using validated methods.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Surufatinib (Cycle 1 and 3): Day 1: predose;1, 2, 4, 8,12 and 24 hours postdose. Toripalimab (Cycle 1 and 3): predose; 0.5, 2, 6, 12,24,48,96,168,336 and 504 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected at the designated time points.Cmax is the highest concentration of drug in the blood that is measured after a dose.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Surufatinib (Cycle 1 and 3): Day 1: predose;1, 2, 4, 8,12 and 24 hours postdose. Toripalimab (Cycle 1 and 3): predose; 0.5, 2, 6, 12,24,48,96,168,336 and 504 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples will be collected at the designated time points. AUC represents the overall amount of drug in the bloodstream after dosing.

arm_group.description: Surufatinib 250mg will be taken orally once daily continuously through a 21-day cycle of study treatment. Toripalimab 240mg will be intravenously administered on Day 1 of each cycle.

intervention.description: Surufatinib is a tablet in the form of 50mg, oral, once a day.
Toripalimab is an injection in the form of 240mg, intravenous, once three weeks.
